thread.title: PCHS Roundup: Revenge and a record for Lady Dragons
thread.title_full: PCHS Roundup: Revenge and a record for Lady Dragons

author: Steve Stein Times correspondent
title: PCHS Roundup: Revenge and a record for Lady Dragons
text: Times correspondent Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 12:09 AM Hannah Thompson returned to the Pekin lineup Tuesday and the Lady Dragons beat visiting Metamora 25-18, 25-12 in a Mid-Illini Conference volleyball match in Dawson Hawkins Gymnasium. Thompson hurt her back Saturday in the O’Fallon Invitational and the sophomore star missed Pekin’s last two matches. She had nine digs, eight kills and two ace serves Tuesday as Pekin (21-12, 8-5) moved in front of Metamora (23-11, 7-6) into fourth place in the conference standings. Pekin coach Yvonne Thompson — Hannah’s mother — said Hannah isn’t 100 percent healthy but “she felt pretty good Tuesday. We’ll have to see how she’s feeling each day.” Maddy Cash (nine kills, 12 digs), Haley Peterson (14 assists, eight digs), Sam Mayberry (two aces, 1.5 blocks) and Alexus Mercer (1.5 blocks) also played key roles in Pekin’s win, which avenged an earlier loss to the Redbirds. The Lady Dragons’ eight conference victories are the most since Pekin joined the Mid-Illini in 2006. Limestone (11-2), Morton (11-2) and Washington (9-4) are in front of the Lady Dragons in the conference standings with one match to go. Pekin plays at Limestone tonight in a regular-season finale. It’s over The Pekin boys soccer season has come to an end. No. 2 seed Moline beat No. 9 seed Pekin 7-0 Tuesday in the opening round of the Normal West Regional, sending the Dragons home with a 3-12-2 record in Gus Kormah’s first year as coach. “As usual, we played a good game for 30 minutes and then the levee broke after a sub or two,” Kormah said. “I’m proud of how my kids played, but Moline is a few steps ahead of us. Next year, we start our rebuilding process.” Angel Vargas (13th minute and 31st minute), Anfernu Crompton (36th minute), Kaleb Dothard (38th minute), Armando Trigueros (39th minute) and Diego Gonzalez (41st minute and 59th minute) scored for Moline, which outshot Pekin 19-2.
